title: Although performance degradation under massive regions is a known issue, in addition to merging regions, are there other methods available?
body:
## Bug Report

<!-- Thanks for your bug report! Don't worry if you can't fill out all the sections. -->

### What version of TiKV are you using?
v8.2.0

### Steps to reproduce
step1:
1. br restore full datase with 50,000 databases and 250,000 tables (5 tables per databse,2 rows per table and the number of empty region is about 480kï¼‰
2. warmup for 10m
3. sysbench run oltp_read_write 5m v1
4. sysbench run oltp_read_write 5m v2
step2:
1. br restore full datase with 1 databases and 16 tables (10M rows per table)
2. warmup for 10m
3. sysbench run oltp_read_write 5m v1
4. sysbench run oltp_read_write 5m v2

### What did you expect?
There is no performance regression with  250,000  tables compared with 16 tables when there are many empty regions. 
### What did happened?
With V2 enabled, the performance of 50,000 databases experiences a 17.22% regression compared to that of a single database.

comments_data.body: Can be closed as https://github.com/tikv/tikv/pull/17408 is merged.
